original_title: Sri Lanka looking at energy exports in the future
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); Sri Lanka is one of the countries that can export renewable energy, said the country's President in Parliament on Tuesday (12).
President Ranil Wickremesinghe said that Sri Lanka is looking at the future of renewable energy, as the country has vast potential in that sector.

"We have all this energy, which we don’t really require. We can sell some to India on connectivity, but we have to go in for green hydrogen and green ammonia, which will also help Colombo and as a port because green hydrogen will be used by the shipping industry. So we have this tremendous potential which we have to use on which we have to do research and be ahead. I have already spoken with Germany on helping us on green technology. Similarly with France as to how they have established green industries. We are also having Australian private sector advising us. Australia wants to be a green hydrogen superpower. So we are working with them," the President went in to detail.
He also added that Sri Lanka has the potential to export energy to other countries.

"We have the potential to export. India can make more than us, but India can never export. It’s needed locally. China can make more than us, they need it locally. But we are one of the countries that can export renewable energy," he added.
